conclusion: Analyze the graph and reciprocal relationship between velocity and displacement.
Graph shows 1/v as a function of displacement x with a straight line and positive slope.
As x increases, 1/v increases, meaning v decreases with increasing x.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Decreasing velocity indicates the particle is slowing down, suggesting deceleration.
1/v is a linear function of x, expressed as 1/v = mx + c.
If dv/dt (acceleration) is negative, the particle is decelerating.
Since 1/v increases linearly with x, v decreases with x, indicating deceleration.
